name: Job Tips For GEEKS: The Job Search
body:
### Dave Fecak has just released his first ebook **Job Tips For Geeks: The Job Search**, which is to be the first in a series designed to help software engineers and other technology professionals to navigate their careers.

### The book is divided into four chapters which represent the lifecycle of a job search, delivered chronologically.


# Buy from

## [Amazon (Kindle)](http://www.amazon.com/dp/B00DAHLIA6)

## [iTunes (iPad iBooks)](https://itunes.apple.com/us/book/job-tips-for-geeks-job-search/id660061997?mt=11)

## [Barnes and Noble (Nook)](http://www.barnesandnoble.com/w/job-tips-for-geeks-dave-fecak/1115567760?ean=2940016623504)

## [Kobo](http://www.kobobooks.com/ebook/Job-Tips-For-Geeks-The/book-f7KXQZkUzEabgdLI6_vU5g/page1.html)


* **Chapter I** – _Before the Search_ includes sections on proactive steps to be taken before starting any activity.  Resumes, references, job search strategy, and your online reputation are covered here.

* **Chapter II** – _Starting the Search_ provides a guide to implementing your search strategy, the pros and cons of the various search methods (secrets to dealing with agency technical recruiters, job boards, etc.), and a unique tactic I’ve dubbed actively passive search.

* **Chapter III** – _During the Search_ talks about activity monitoring and metrics and why you may not be getting positive responses, phone screen and interview preparation, interview tactics, follow-up, and negotiating job offers.

* **Chapter IV** – _After the Search_ runs through all the steps after you have chosen which job you want.  How to accept and reject offers, write resignation letters, and use your job search to maximize your technology career.
